title: Introduction to Electronic Analysis and Design
description: Covers voltage and current sources, resistive circuits, nodal and loop analysis, network theorems, energy storage elements, RC, RL, and RLC circuits, sinusoidal steady-state analysis, AC power, frequency response, filters, transformers, and two-port networks.

title: Engineering Projects in Community Service
description: Introduction to the basic concepts of electronic circuit analysis and design. Topics include circuit analysis techniques, linear circuit elements, operational amplifiers, and digital logic.

title: Digital System Design
description: An introduction to digital system design and hardware engineering, with an emphasis on practical design techniques and circuit implementation.

title: Signals and Systems
description: Classification, analysis and design of systems in both the continuous-time and discrete-time domains. Continuous-time linear systems: Fourier Series, Fourier Transform, bilateral Laplace Transform. Discrete-time linear systems: difference equations, Discrete-Time Fourier Transform, bilateral Z-Transform.

title: Microprocessor Systems and Interfacing
description: An introduction to basic computer organization, microprocessor instruction sets, assembly language programming, and microcontroller peripherals.

title: Python for Data Science
description: Introduction to Python programming with an emphasis on data science applications. Topics include basic programming concepts, data structures, file I/O, plotting, and basic data analysis techniques.

title: Contemporary Issues in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Focuses on contemporary issues in electrical and computer engineering, including professional ethics, leadership, and career development.

title: Software Security
description: This course teaches principles of secure software design, secure programming, software vulnerability analysis, and exploitation techniques. Topics include buffer overflows, format string vulnerabilities, web security, and secure software development practices.

title: Computer Design and Prototyping
description: An introduction to computer organization and design. Topics include instruction set architecture, CPU design, pipelining, cache and memory systems, and I/O.

title: Introduction to Compilers and Translation Engineering
description: Design and construction of compilers and other translators. Covers practical aspects of compiler construction including lexical analysis, parsing, code generation, and optimization.
